page.title: 16Sites Around Birnie.
page.content: Birnie lies only a few miles South of Elgin which has been the main town in Moray for hundreds of years. Elgin has a cathedral, burnt down by the Wolf of Badenoch in 1390, and is currently being restored. The ruins of Elgin Castle lie at the top of Lady Hill, where the monument of the Duke of Gordon towers over the City of Elgin. There are many churches in Elgin including St Giles Church which stands in the middle of the High Street. There are also many churches in the Elgin Area including Spynie Church, Pluscarden Abbey and Birnie Church. Six miles to the North lies the Moray Firth Coast along which there are many beautiful beaches enjoyed by the number of tourists who visit the area. The beaches at Lossiemouth, Hopeman and Roseisle are particular pleasant.
